content: Oil prices have plunged to one-year lows, but refiners in certain parts of the U.S. are not benefitting from cheaper crude. According to new data from the EIA, refining margins for motor gasoline have fallen to five-year lows. “Flattening year-over-year growt… [+4266 chars]

title: What Crashing Refining Margins Mean For Oil Markets
